skill.name: python-venv-manager
skill.description: Python virtual environment management, dependency handling, and project setup automation.
skill.summary: Python virtual environment management, dependency handling, and project setup automation.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing educational content about Python virtual environments. No executable code, scripts, or network operations are present. The skill provides instructions and best practices for managing Python dependencies and virtual environments.

content.value_statement: Struggling with Python dependency conflicts and virtual environment setup? This skill provides expert guidance on creating, managing, and troubleshooting Python virtual environments using modern tools like Poetry, pipenv, and pyenv.
actual_capabilities: Create and configure Python virtual environments
Manage dependencies with Poetry, pip-tools, and pipenv
Set up Python version management with pyenv
Troubleshoot dependency conflicts and installation issues
Configure development environments with testing and linting
limitations: Requires existing Python installation on system
Some tools (Poetry, pyenv) need separate installation
Platform-specific commands may vary (Windows vs Linux/Mac)
Cannot directly execute commands - provides instructions only

best_practices: Always use virtual environments - never install packages globally
Pin exact dependency versions in production using lock files
anti_patterns: Using sudo pip install or installing packages system-wide
Committing virtual environment folders to version control
Using unpinned dependencies in production environments

faq.question: Which tool should I use - venv, virtualenv, or Poetry?
faq.answer: Use venv for simple projects, Poetry for modern dependency management with lock files and publishing capabilities.

faq.question: How do I activate virtual environments on Windows?
faq.answer: Use 'venv\Scripts\activate' on Windows instead of 'source venv/bin/activate' used on Linux/Mac.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing requirements.txt files?
faq.answer: Yes, you can migrate existing projects. Use 'poetry add $(cat requirements.txt)' to import dependencies.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using dependency management tools?
faq.answer: These tools only manage Python packages. They don't access personal data or send information externally.

faq.question: What if I get 'command not found' errors?
faq.answer: Ensure the tool is installed and in your PATH. For Poetry, use the official installer script.

faq.question: How does this compare to conda environments?
faq.answer: Python venv is lighter and Python-specific. Conda handles multiple languages but is heavier and slower.
